Posts.Content: bizzemomof3 wrote: First hello everyone, new hear. My mom was diagnosed back in August 2002 and recently lost her battle Oct 3, 2007. Also my fathers sisters all 3 of them have breast cancer the youngest being diagnosed at age 41 also paternal grandmother her 2 sisters hade it. I am now 35 and was supposed to go get my mammo at 32. (which I didn't) I have very large and dense breasts. I am getting ready to make an appointment for genetic testing (scared). What I guess I really want to know is if I should fight for the MRI instead of the mammo they say me and my sisters are HIGH RISK. So if someone could help me I would be gratefull. Thanks again. Posts.Title: mammo vs mri bizzemomof3 rds

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2007 06:49PM bizzemomof3 wrote: both of you thank you so much for your input and I wish you both well. I know positive attitude and laughter is the best medicine. My mom had a positivie attitude up until the end and I think that is what kept her going. Thank you again. Good luck with everthing
